private_information: You can move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You move exactly one disk at a time from the top of a peg.
Never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to achieve the final configuration while only moving the disks you are allowed to move.

private_information: You can move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
You move exactly one disk at a time from the top of a peg.
Never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to achieve the final configuration while only moving the disks you are allowed to move.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency of the move sequence.
You ensure no bookkeeping shortcuts are used (no quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or other non-physical allowances).
You enforce that only legal Tower of Hanoi moves occur (move one top disk at a time, never place a larger disk on a smaller disk) and that agent restrictions are respected.
auditor.goal: Audit and, if necessary, minimally repair the candidate move sequence so it is legal and consistent with agent restrictions and achieves the goal.

private_information: You coordinate all agents and compile the final plan into a PDDL domain and problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver.
Keep actions of agent_1 and agent_2 distinct in the PDDL (e.g., separate action schemas or typed constraints).
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the audited move sequence and produce the final PDDL domain and problem capturing the two-agent Tower of Hanoi with the specified initial and goal configurations.

init.ordered_move_format: agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2

public_information: Two-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labelled A (smallest) to O (largest) and pegs left, middle, right.
Agent movement restrictions: agent_1 can move A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 can move I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial configuration: left peg has top->bottom A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has top->bottom A, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has top->bottom B, C; right peg has top->bottom D.
Only one disk may be moved at a time, and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
reference_solution: agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk B from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk C from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to left
agent_1: move disk B from right to middle
agent_1: move disk A from left to middle
agent_1: move disk D from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to left

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Propose a concrete, legal Tower of Hanoi move sequence that achieves the goal using only disks A-H and never emitting PDDL; output the primitive moves as a list of strings in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
propose_moves.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Objective: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce a minimal, legal sequence. Respect the ordered move format exactly.

resource_check.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You do not emit PDDL. Analyze whether any moves of disks I-O are needed given the goal and confirm constraints for your controllable disks. If no moves are needed, state that succinctly.
resource_check.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Objective: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Determine whether your disks must move to achieve the goal; if not, return a short confirmation that no moves are required for I-O and restate the constraint set you will enforce.

audit_sequence.system_prompt: You are the auditor. You do not emit PDDL. Verify temporal/causal consistency and strict Tower of Hanoi legality: exactly one top disk moves per step, never place a larger disk on a smaller disk, and respect agent-specific disk permissions. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts and, if needed, minimally repair the sequence while preserving the goal.
audit_sequence.prompt: Context: {environment->public_information}. Candidate move list: {moves_agent_1}. Agent-2 constraints: {constraints_agent_2}. Deliver an audited, final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' that achieves the goal.

integrate_and_compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator for a multi-agent Tower of Hanoi. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver. Keep agent actions distinct (e.g., separate action schemas for agent_1 and agent_2 with appropriate disk typing or permissions). Use STRIPS-compatible constructs and include all objects (disks A-O and pegs left, middle, right), predicates for on, clear, smaller, and peg. Encode agent capability via types (lightdisk vs heavydisk) or explicit constraints. Provide the exact initial state and the exact goal configuration described in the environment, and ensure the goal matches the specified arrangement. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem> tags.
integrate_and_compile_pddl.prompt: Audited move sequence: {audited_moves}. Compile the full two-agent Tower of Hanoi task into a final PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward. The domain must expose distinct move operators for agent_1 (only disks A-H) and agent_2 (only disks I-O). The problem must instantiate all 15 disks and pegs and set the initial and goal configurations exactly as specified in {environment->init}.
